p: There were 215/1159 (19%) articles reporting travel-related CHIKV infections; Table 1. These results included 74/215 (34%) studies where travelers acquired their infections during travel to endemic countries, while 81/215 (38%) studies reported that travelers developed clinical symptoms days after returning to their home countries from a chikungunya endemic country where they were exposed to the virus. Of the travel-related studies, 29/215 (13%) studied prevalence of chikungunya infection among travelers.
